ICASSP 2025

Low-field MRI Signal processing challenge

 9th April, 2025

 Hyderabad, India


The recent resurgence of portable, very low-field MRI systems to improve accessibility is constrained by image quality challenges compared to clinical scanners. The advent of machine learning methods provides a unique opportunity to address gaps in image resolution and signal-to-noise ratio (SNR). As very-low-field MRI gains the attention of the wider research community, this timely grand challenge invites participants from complementary backgrounds in signal processing, MRI analysis, machine learning, and related fields to break ground on this important topic of image quality. The challenge will start in September 2024 and last until June 2025.

Why attend?

Challenges

The challenge has two tracks: 1. Image denoising and 2. Super-resolution reconstruction.

Data

We have two data sets: 1. 47mT phantom data and 2. 0.3T paired data!

Mentors

We have a team of elite mentors available on site. They will guide attendees throughout the event whether you are a beginner or a seasoned engineer!
